388$Bipolar I Disorder with Most Recent Episode Mixed$5/11/2008 6:59:37 PM$Reviewer: cabellero37, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$3$5$ I was recently given tegretol as a mood stabilizer for bipolar. I’m taking 100mg in the morning and 100mg in the evening. I’m also taking 20mg of adderall RX in the morning. Ever since I started to take the tegretol I feel very fatigued. I find myself fighting to stay awake about 45 minutes after taking tegretol and at times I end up taking a 30 to 45 min cat nap after taking it in the morning.  Although it has be a very short time taking this medication I’m hoping this does not lead to long term side affects with the fatigue and drowsiness. I would of thought the adderall would of counter acted any of the sedation affects of tegretol but so far it has no affect at all Over all I do feel much better taking tegretol but hate these two side affects I’m currently experiencing. .

column1: 410$Manic-Depression$1/10/2008 7:45:04 PM$Reviewer: animalover46
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more$5$5$5$I'm a 46 yr old bi-polar male who has taken tegretol for mood swings since I was 19 yrs old.  The medicine works great with stabilizing my moods and the only problem I have is when I had either ran out of it or stopped taking it and had to go through withdrawls.  This medicine took over having to take lithium.

column1: 413$Manic-Depression$1/6/2008 10:39:51 PM$Reviewer: celticmaiden
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$3$4$Tegretol seems to help me identify my depression from periods when I'm manic; this helps because knowing what mode I'm in
column3: I can treat the symptoms of depression like not being too hard on myself
column7: make sure that I eat. When I realize that I'm manic
column8: I treat the symptoms by taking a walk to release increased energy & journaling to purge myself of racy thoughts. I still cycle about every 2 weeks
column9: and I have terrible problems with irritablity & anger management. Whether manic or depressed
column10: its all about self-care. Before taking tegretol
column11: I was in a state of constant chaios because I didn't understand what was happening with my mind. I thought I was either going crazy or just being carefree; I couldn't understand why I couldn't keep a job and such. The only side effect I feel I have is fatigue. Tegretol does not do alot to control my manic-deppresive episodes; there are times I feel like I could crawl out of my skin
column13: and things seem so surreal or I get so depressed that I don't get out of bed for a couple of days feeling catatonic. Like I stated before
column14: the tegretol does help me identify my mood swings somewhat and that helps.

column1: 496$Manic-Depression$4/4/2009 8:12:36 AM$Reviewer: ILuvRoses1987
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on it for 7 years or so now.   I swear by it.     In the beginning it was hard to say the least. Not going to lie....  Those side effect were AWFUL.  I had every last side effect
column3: you name it I had it.. except it has never made me tired. The dry mouth was by FAR THE WORST.  If you can get through those side effects which don't last forever. Mine pretty much disapeared within a month or so...the worst ones disapearing first I must add.  I would highly recomend it for the treatment of someone trying to cope with bipolar at the end of a short rope.  I have tried ALL the bipolar meds out there in every combo you can dream up except lithium and depakote...so I've circled the block a few times and this is deff worth a try.
